Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL
Name: Pitcher
Description: Pitcher with narrow mouth, pouring spout and short neck with moulding at the top. The body is bitruncate cone-shaped with a curvature in the upper third. The pitcher has a stable base with a very high ring-shaped foot. It has a ribbon handle with a double longitudinal incision, starting at the neck and ending at the top of the body. Pink-coloured paste and exterior surface covered with a reddish coating, partially lost.
